title: Destination
lyrics:
One, two
 One, two, three go
 You don't owe me
 One more minute of your wasted time
 You act like it's all fine
 All the years I gave you
 Thinking you knew that you wanted me
 I wanted to believe
 I've gotta make a destination
 Find where I belong
 This time I've got no hesitation
 I'll be movin' on (to where I belong)
 I'm movin' on
 I'm tired of trying
 To describe what you will never see
 How good we could be
 You gave up and lost touch
 And now you're looking for a little grace
 Well, look at my face
 I've gotta make a destination, ooh-oh-oh
 Find where I belong
 There ain't no time for hesitation, ooh-oh-oh
 I'm movin' on (to where I belong)
 I'm movin' on (over the light of dawn)
 I'm already gone (gone)
 Empty corner but I keep movin'
 Taking hits while you've been missing
 Night after night after I hear you
 Say we're solid
 But I know we're looking through the cracks
 In our little pact
 It isn't hard to leave
 Knowing that I'll be getting life on track
 Never looking back
 I've gotta make a destination, ooh-oh-oh
 Find where I belong
 This time, I've got no hesitation, ooh-oh-oh
 I'm already gone (I'm moving on)
 Find where I belong (over the light of dawn)
 I'm moving on (find where I belong)
 I'm already gone

 Ladies and gentlemen, just tell her where you want to go, that's Sara Watkins
 Yeah

expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.text: Flee from sexual immorality. All other sins a person commits are outside the body, but whoever sins sexually, sins against their own body. Do you not know that your bodies are temples of the Holy Spirit?
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.relevance: Sexual purity is not just a moral guideline but a recognition that our bodies are sacred dwelling places of God's Spirit.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.application: Choose music that honors the sacredness of sexuality within God's design and avoid content that promotes casual or immoral sexual behavior.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_value: This passage helps understand why sexual_content is concerning from a biblical perspective.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.concern_explanation: Sexual content outside biblical marriage context can promote impure thoughts and desires.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_context: Biblical foundation for understanding sexual_content concerns

expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.text: It is God's will that you should be sanctified: that you should avoid sexual immorality; that each of you should learn to control your own body in a way that is holy and honorable.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.relevance: God's will for believers includes sexual purity as part of our overall sanctification and spiritual growth.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.application: Select music that supports your commitment to sexual purity and helps you maintain holy thoughts and desires.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_value: This passage helps understand why sexual_content is concerning from a biblical perspective.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.concern_explanation: Sexual content outside biblical marriage context can promote impure thoughts and desires.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_context: Biblical foundation for understanding sexual_content concerns

expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.text: But I tell you that anyone who looks at a woman lustfully has already committed adultery with her in his heart.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.relevance: Jesus teaches that sexual purity begins in the heart and mind, not just in physical actions.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.application: Be mindful that music can influence your thought life; choose content that helps maintain pure thoughts.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_value: This passage helps understand why sexual_content is concerning from a biblical perspective.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.concern_explanation: Sexual content outside biblical marriage context can promote impure thoughts and desires.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_context: Biblical foundation for understanding sexual_content concerns

expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.text: May the God of hope fill you with all joy and peace as you trust in him, so that you may overflow with hope by the power of the Holy Spirit.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.relevance: God is the ultimate source of hope, providing supernatural joy and peace even in difficult circumstances.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.application: While acknowledging struggles is healthy, balance music that expresses pain with content that points to God's hope and healing.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_value: This passage helps understand why despair_hopelessness is concerning from a biblical perspective.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.concern_explanation: While acknowledging struggles is healthy, constant focus on despair without hope can be spiritually harmful.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_context: Biblical foundation for understanding despair_hopelessness concerns

expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.text: Why, my soul, are you downcast? Why so disturbed within me? Put your hope in God, for I will yet praise him, my Savior and my God.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.relevance: Even in depression and despair, believers can redirect their thoughts toward God's faithfulness and future deliverance.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.application: Choose music that acknowledges emotional struggles but also encourages faith and hope in God's goodness.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_value: This passage helps understand why despair_hopelessness is concerning from a biblical perspective.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.concern_explanation: While acknowledging struggles is healthy, constant focus on despair without hope can be spiritually harmful.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_context: Biblical foundation for understanding despair_hopelessness concerns

expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.text: Therefore we do not lose heart. Though outwardly we are wasting away, yet inwardly we are being renewed day by day. For our light and momentary troubles are achieving for us an eternal glory.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.relevance: Present sufferings are temporary and serve a purpose in God's plan, leading to future glory and spiritual growth.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.application: Select music that maintains eternal perspective on current struggles and encourages perseverance through difficulty.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_value: This passage helps understand why despair_hopelessness is concerning from a biblical perspective.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.concern_explanation: While acknowledging struggles is healthy, constant focus on despair without hope can be spiritually harmful.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_context: Biblical foundation for understanding despair_hopelessness concerns

expected_purity_flags_details.description: Sexual content outside biblical marriage context can promote impure thoughts and desires.
expected_purity_flags_details.biblical_perspective: 1 Corinthians 6:18-20 calls us to honor God with our bodies and flee sexual immorality.
expected_purity_flags_details.educational_value: This content shows sexual purity concerns. Sexual content outside biblical marriage context can promote impure thoughts and desires. Biblical guidance: 1 Corinthians 6:18-20 calls us to honor God with our bodies and flee sexual immorality. Consider: Focus on pure love, commitment, and God-honoring relationships.

expected_purity_flags_details.description: While acknowledging struggles is healthy, constant focus on despair without hope can be spiritually harmful.
expected_purity_flags_details.biblical_perspective: Romans 15:13 declares God as the source of hope who fills us with joy and peace.
expected_purity_flags_details.educational_value: This content shows despair and mental health concerns. While acknowledging struggles is healthy, constant focus on despair without hope can be spiritually harmful. Biblical guidance: Romans 15:13 declares God as the source of hope who fills us with joy and peace. Consider: Balance honest expression of difficulties with reminders of God's love, hope, and healing.

title: Trip Around the Sun
lyrics:
Well they say the sea is rising,
 Well that's alright with me
 Cause there ain't no other place than on the sea I'd rather be.
 And that second comet's comin',
 Tt's right around the bend.
 And some day could be any day
 This world is gonna end
 But that's alright
 That's okay.
 There ain't nothing we can do about the whole thing anyway.
 It's a hang on kinda ride,
 Were spinning through space and time,
 Rockin' this big old rock just tryn'a have fun
 So let's drink another beer
 Here's to another year
 Let's take another crazy trip
 Around the sun

 We're all swimmin' in a fish bowl,
 Just floatin' through the sky
 Pulled along by gravity
 And nobody knows why
 So it's a Cosmic Hallelujah
 That we're sittin' here right now
 And Becky's at the bar
 Buyin' us all another round,
 And that's okay,
 Yeah that's alright
 I ain't gonna over think or over analyze tonight
 It's a hang on kinda ride,
 Were spinning through space and time
 Rockin' this big old rock just tryn'a have fun
 So let's drink another beer
 Here's to another year
 Let's take another crazy trip around the sun

 We're just hands up, roller coasterflyin' with no breaks.
 We're just speck up, salt rollin' down a tidal wave.
 We're just Babe Ruth, baseball hit over the wall.
 We're just a drop of rain over a waterfall.
 It's a hang on kinda ride,
 Were spinning through space and time
 Rockin' this big old rock just tryn'a have fun.
 So let's drink another beer
 Here's to another year
 Let's take another crazy trip around the sun
 Let's take another crazy trip around the sun

expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.text: Do you not know that your bodies are temples of the Holy Spirit, who is in you, whom you have received from God? You are not your own; you were bought at a price. Therefore honor God with your bodies.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.relevance: Our bodies belong to God and should be treated with the respect due to His dwelling place. Substance abuse dishonors this sacred relationship.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.application: Choose music that promotes healthy living and respect for the body as God's temple, avoiding content that glorifies substance abuse.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_value: This passage helps understand why substance_abuse is concerning from a biblical perspective.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.concern_explanation: Substance use can impair judgment and become a substitute for finding peace in God.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_context: Biblical foundation for understanding substance_abuse concerns

expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.text: Wine is a mocker and beer a brawler; whoever is led astray by them is not wise.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.relevance: Scripture warns against being controlled by alcohol or substances that impair judgment and lead to unwise decisions.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.application: Select music that promotes wisdom and clear thinking rather than celebrating intoxication or substance use.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_value: This passage helps understand why substance_abuse is concerning from a biblical perspective.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.concern_explanation: Substance use can impair judgment and become a substitute for finding peace in God.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_context: Biblical foundation for understanding substance_abuse concerns

expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.text: So I say, walk by the Spirit, and you will not gratify the desires of the flesh. For the flesh desires what is contrary to the Spirit.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.relevance: Living by the Spirit means rejecting fleshly desires, including dependencies on substances for comfort or escape.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.application: Choose music that encourages spiritual dependence on God rather than physical dependence on substances.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_value: This passage helps understand why substance_abuse is concerning from a biblical perspective.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.concern_explanation: Substance use can impair judgment and become a substitute for finding peace in God.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_context: Biblical foundation for understanding substance_abuse concerns

expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.text: But I tell you, do not resist an evil person. If anyone slaps you on the right cheek, turn to them the other cheek also.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.relevance: Jesus teaches a radical alternative to violence - responding to aggression with love and restraint rather than retaliation.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.application: Choose music that promotes peace-making and love over violence, even when facing conflict or injustice.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_value: This passage helps understand why violence_aggression is concerning from a biblical perspective.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.concern_explanation: Violent themes can promote aggression rather than the peace Christ calls us to.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_context: Biblical foundation for understanding violence_aggression concerns

expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.text: Do not take revenge, my dear friends, but leave room for God's wrath, for it is written: "It is mine to avenge; I will repay," says the Lord. On the contrary: "If your enemy is hungry, feed him; if he is thirsty, give him something to drink."
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.relevance: God calls believers to overcome evil with good, trusting Him for justice rather than taking matters into our own hands.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.application: Select music that inspires forgiveness and kindness toward enemies rather than promoting aggressive responses.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_value: This passage helps understand why violence_aggression is concerning from a biblical perspective.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.concern_explanation: Violent themes can promote aggression rather than the peace Christ calls us to.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_context: Biblical foundation for understanding violence_aggression concerns

expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.text: Get rid of all bitterness, rage and anger, brawling and slander, along with every form of malice. Be kind and compassionate to one another, forgiving each other, just as in Christ God forgave you.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.relevance: Christians are called to eliminate aggressive emotions and behaviors, replacing them with kindness and forgiveness.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.application: Choose music that promotes emotional healing and forgiveness rather than feeding anger or aggressive feelings.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_value: This passage helps understand why violence_aggression is concerning from a biblical perspective.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.concern_explanation: Violent themes can promote aggression rather than the peace Christ calls us to.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_context: Biblical foundation for understanding violence_aggression concerns

expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.text: Let everyone be subject to the governing authorities, for there is no authority except that which God has established.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.relevance: God establishes human authority structures and expects believers to respect them, even when we disagree.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.application: Choose music that promotes respect for legitimate authority while maintaining allegiance to God's ultimate authority.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_value: This passage helps understand why rebellion_authority is concerning from a biblical perspective.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.concern_explanation: Constant rebellion against legitimate authority contradicts biblical principles of submission and respect.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_context: Biblical foundation for understanding rebellion_authority concerns

expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.text: Have confidence in your leaders and submit to their authority, because they keep watch over you as those who must give an account.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.relevance: Submission to authority is not weakness but recognition of God's order and the accountability of leaders.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.application: Select music that encourages working within proper channels for change rather than promoting destructive rebellion.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_value: This passage helps understand why rebellion_authority is concerning from a biblical perspective.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.concern_explanation: Constant rebellion against legitimate authority contradicts biblical principles of submission and respect.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_context: Biblical foundation for understanding rebellion_authority concerns

expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.text: Submit yourselves for the Lord's sake to every human authority: whether to the emperor, as the supreme authority, or to governors, who are sent by him to punish the wrongdoer and to commend those who do right.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.relevance: Submission to authority is ultimately an act of obedience to God, not just compliance with human institutions.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.application: Choose music that demonstrates respect for authority as a way of honoring God, even while seeking justice.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_value: This passage helps understand why rebellion_authority is concerning from a biblical perspective.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.concern_explanation: Constant rebellion against legitimate authority contradicts biblical principles of submission and respect.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_context: Biblical foundation for understanding rebellion_authority concerns

expected_purity_flags_details.description: Substance use can impair judgment and become a substitute for finding peace in God.
expected_purity_flags_details.biblical_perspective: 1 Corinthians 6:19-20 reminds us our bodies are temples of the Holy Spirit.
expected_purity_flags_details.educational_value: This content shows substance use concerns. Substance use can impair judgment and become a substitute for finding peace in God. Biblical guidance: 1 Corinthians 6:19-20 reminds us our bodies are temples of the Holy Spirit. Consider: Seek comfort, joy, and peace through prayer, fellowship, and God's presence.

expected_purity_flags_details.description: Violent themes can promote aggression rather than the peace Christ calls us to.
expected_purity_flags_details.biblical_perspective: Matthew 5:39 teaches us to turn the other cheek rather than seek revenge.
expected_purity_flags_details.educational_value: This content shows violence and aggression concerns. Violent themes can promote aggression rather than the peace Christ calls us to. Biblical guidance: Matthew 5:39 teaches us to turn the other cheek rather than seek revenge. Consider: Embrace forgiveness, peace-making, and resolving conflicts with love.

expected_purity_flags_details.description: Constant rebellion against legitimate authority contradicts biblical principles of submission and respect.
expected_purity_flags_details.biblical_perspective: Romans 13:1 teaches that all authority is established by God.
expected_purity_flags_details.educational_value: This content shows rebellion against authority concerns. Constant rebellion against legitimate authority contradicts biblical principles of submission and respect. Biblical guidance: Romans 13:1 teaches that all authority is established by God. Consider: Address grievances respectfully while honoring God-given authority structures.

title: Shine
lyrics:
Give me a word
 Give me a sign
 Show me where to look
 Tell me, what will I find?
 What will I find?
 Lay me on the ground
 And fly me in the sky
 Show me where to look
 Tell me, what will I find?
 What will I find?

 Yeah
 Yeah
 Yeah
 Whoa, Heaven let your light shine down
 Whoa, Heaven let your light shine down
 Whoa, Heaven let your light shine down
 Whoa, Heaven let your light shine down

 Love is in the water
 Love is in the air
 Show me where to look
 Tell me, will love be there?
 Will love be there?
 Teach me how to speak
 Teach me how to share
 Teach me where to go
 Tell me, will love be there?
 Will love be there?

 Yeah
 Yeah
 Yeah
 Whoa, Heaven let your light shine down
 Whoa, Heaven let your light shine down
 Whoa, Heaven let your light shine down
 Whoa, Heaven let your light shine down

 Give me a word
 Give me a sign
 Show me where to look
 Tell me, what will I find?
 What will I find?
 Lay me on the ground
 And fly me in the sky
 Show me where to look
 Tell me, what will I find?
 What will I find?

 Yeah
 Yeah
 Yeah
 Whoa, Heaven let your light shine down
 Whoa, Heaven let your light shine down
 Whoa, Heaven let your light shine down
 Whoa, Heaven let your light shine down
 I'm gonna let it shine
 I'm gonna let it shine
 Heaven's little light gonna shine on me
 Hey, yeah, hey, yeah
 Heaven's little light gonna shine on me
 (Shine) Shine on me, yeah
 (Shine) Come on and shine

title: Some People Do
lyrics:
I know you're hurt, I know it's my fault
 But I've kept I'm sorry locked in a vault
 I know that time just keeps going on
 And words by themselves can't right all the wrongs
 In a world that's gone crazy
 You don't know what's true
 Most people don't change
 But some people do
 Some people quit drinking too much
 And some people quit lying
 Some people decide to grow up
 But it's never good timing
 Most wouldn't forgive
 What I put you through
 But I'm here tonight
 Hoping some people do

 Some people say sorry to hear it's okay
 But I know it's not, so you don't have to say
 That you understand 'cause I know you don't
 Neither do I, but that don't mean that I won't
 Try every day
 To show you the truth
 Most people don't change
 But some people do
 Some people quit drinking too much
 And some people quit lying
 Some people decide to grow up
 But it's never good timing
 Most wouldn't forgive
 What I put you through
 But I'm here tonight
 Hoping some people do

 So whether you kiss me
 Or you close the door
 Just know that I'm better
 Than I was before
 Some people quit drinking too much
 And some people quit lying
 Some people decide to grow up
 But it's never good timing
 Most wouldn't forgive
 What I put you through
 But I'm here tonight
 Hoping some people do

 I'm hoping some people do

expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.text: Pride goes before destruction, a haughty spirit before a fall.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.relevance: Pride is spiritually dangerous because it leads to poor decisions and separation from God who opposes the proud.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.application: Choose music that promotes humility and dependence on God rather than self-exaltation or arrogance.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_value: This passage helps understand why pride_arrogance is concerning from a biblical perspective.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.concern_explanation: Excessive self-focus can lead to pride and take glory away from God.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_context: Biblical foundation for understanding pride_arrogance concerns

expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.text: But he gives us more grace. That is why Scripture says: "God opposes the proud but shows favor to the humble."
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.relevance: God actively resists pride but blesses humility with His grace and favor.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.application: Select music that cultivates a humble heart and acknowledges our need for God's grace.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_value: This passage helps understand why pride_arrogance is concerning from a biblical perspective.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.concern_explanation: Excessive self-focus can lead to pride and take glory away from God.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_context: Biblical foundation for understanding pride_arrogance concerns

expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.text: Do nothing out of selfish ambition or vain conceit. Rather, in humility value others above yourselves, not looking to your own interests but each of you to the interests of the others.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.relevance: True Christian character involves putting others' needs before our own and avoiding self-centered motivations.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.application: Choose music that inspires service to others and selfless love rather than self-focused content.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_value: This passage helps understand why pride_arrogance is concerning from a biblical perspective.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.concern_explanation: Excessive self-focus can lead to pride and take glory away from God.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_context: Biblical foundation for understanding pride_arrogance concerns

expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.text: Jesus answered, "I am the way and the truth and the life. No one comes to the Father except through me."
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.relevance: Jesus claims to be the exclusive path to God, making Christianity unique among world religions.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.application: Avoid music that promotes religious pluralism or suggests multiple paths to God apart from Jesus Christ.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_value: This passage helps understand why false_teaching is concerning from a biblical perspective.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.concern_explanation: Teachings that contradict core Christian doctrines can lead believers away from biblical truth.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_context: Biblical foundation for understanding false_teaching concerns

expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.text: But even if we or an angel from heaven should preach a gospel other than the one we preached to you, let them be under God's curse!
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.relevance: The gospel message is unchanging and must not be modified to fit cultural preferences or alternative teachings.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.application: Be cautious of music that modifies core Christian doctrines or promotes teachings contrary to Scripture.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_value: This passage helps understand why false_teaching is concerning from a biblical perspective.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.concern_explanation: Teachings that contradict core Christian doctrines can lead believers away from biblical truth.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_context: Biblical foundation for understanding false_teaching concerns

expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.text: For the time will come when people will not put up with sound doctrine. Instead, to suit their own desires, they will gather around them a great number of teachers to say what their itching ears want to hear.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.relevance: There is a natural human tendency to prefer comfortable lies over difficult truths, making discernment essential.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.application: Choose music that challenges you with biblical truth rather than simply reinforcing what you want to hear.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_value: This passage helps understand why false_teaching is concerning from a biblical perspective.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.concern_explanation: Teachings that contradict core Christian doctrines can lead believers away from biblical truth.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_context: Biblical foundation for understanding false_teaching concerns

expected_purity_flags_details.description: Sexual content outside biblical marriage context can promote impure thoughts and desires.
expected_purity_flags_details.biblical_perspective: 1 Corinthians 6:18-20 calls us to honor God with our bodies and flee sexual immorality.
expected_purity_flags_details.educational_value: This content shows sexual purity concerns. Sexual content outside biblical marriage context can promote impure thoughts and desires. Biblical guidance: 1 Corinthians 6:18-20 calls us to honor God with our bodies and flee sexual immorality. Consider: Focus on pure love, commitment, and God-honoring relationships.

expected_purity_flags_details.description: Substance use can impair judgment and become a substitute for finding peace in God.
expected_purity_flags_details.biblical_perspective: 1 Corinthians 6:19-20 reminds us our bodies are temples of the Holy Spirit.
expected_purity_flags_details.educational_value: This content shows substance use concerns. Substance use can impair judgment and become a substitute for finding peace in God. Biblical guidance: 1 Corinthians 6:19-20 reminds us our bodies are temples of the Holy Spirit. Consider: Seek comfort, joy, and peace through prayer, fellowship, and God's presence.

expected_purity_flags_details.description: Violent themes can promote aggression rather than the peace Christ calls us to.
expected_purity_flags_details.biblical_perspective: Matthew 5:39 teaches us to turn the other cheek rather than seek revenge.
expected_purity_flags_details.educational_value: This content shows violence and aggression concerns. Violent themes can promote aggression rather than the peace Christ calls us to. Biblical guidance: Matthew 5:39 teaches us to turn the other cheek rather than seek revenge. Consider: Embrace forgiveness, peace-making, and resolving conflicts with love.

expected_purity_flags_details.description: Excessive self-focus can lead to pride and take glory away from God.
expected_purity_flags_details.biblical_perspective: Proverbs 16:18 warns that pride goes before destruction and a haughty spirit before a fall.
expected_purity_flags_details.educational_value: This content shows pride and self-focus concerns. Excessive self-focus can lead to pride and take glory away from God. Biblical guidance: Proverbs 16:18 warns that pride goes before destruction and a haughty spirit before a fall. Consider: Practice humility, recognizing that all good things come from God.

expected_purity_flags_details.description: Teachings that contradict core Christian doctrines can lead believers away from biblical truth.
expected_purity_flags_details.biblical_perspective: John 14:6 declares Jesus as the only way to the Father.
expected_purity_flags_details.educational_value: This content shows false teaching and heresy concerns. Teachings that contradict core Christian doctrines can lead believers away from biblical truth. Biblical guidance: John 14:6 declares Jesus as the only way to the Father. Consider: Affirm the exclusivity of Christ and salvation by grace through faith alone.

title: Electricity
lyrics:
Time in the frequency
The whole world is listening
From the wild west stories
North pole, south pole and everywhere in between
The way it takes over me
Like the power of a lightning bolt
I let it on me, move me
Makes me feel like i'm out of control

Take it over (it's electricity)
Take it over me
Take it over (it's electricity)
Take it over me
Take it over me (it's electricity)
Take it over me (it's electricity)
Take it over me

Second of complicity
All the years of my memories
Every stop in every city,
Every bar every state and everthing in between
Every getaway story that I know
Every path that I let go
All the ants in the street
Places full of people
Sending me out of control

Take it over (it's electricity)
Take it over me
Take it over (it's electricity)
Take it over me
Take it over me (it's electricity)
Take it over me (it's electricity)
Take it over me
Take it over me (it's electricity)
Take it over me

You're only (you're only)
Strong as you let you become
You're only (you're only)
You're only (you're only)
Strong as you let you become

Take it over (it's electricity)
Take it over me
Take it over (it's electricity)
Take it over me
Take it over me (it's electricity)
Take it over me (it's electricity)
Take it over me
Take it over me (it's electricity)
Take it over me

expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.text: For the love of money is a root of all kinds of evil. Some people, eager for money, have wandered from the faith and pierced themselves with many griefs.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.relevance: The pursuit of wealth can become an idol that leads us away from God and causes spiritual harm.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.application: Choose music that promotes contentment and gratitude rather than materialism and the pursuit of wealth.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_value: This passage helps understand why materialism_greed is concerning from a biblical perspective.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.concern_explanation: Excessive focus on material wealth can distract from spiritual priorities and contentment in God.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_context: Biblical foundation for understanding materialism_greed concerns

expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.text: Do not store up for yourselves treasures on earth, where moths and vermin destroy, and where thieves break in and steal. But store up for yourselves treasures in heaven.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.relevance: Jesus teaches that earthly possessions are temporary and unreliable, while spiritual investments have eternal value.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.application: Select music that focuses on eternal values and spiritual growth rather than temporary material pursuits.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_value: This passage helps understand why materialism_greed is concerning from a biblical perspective.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.concern_explanation: Excessive focus on material wealth can distract from spiritual priorities and contentment in God.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_context: Biblical foundation for understanding materialism_greed concerns

expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.text: Keep your lives free from the love of money and be content with what you have, because God has said, "Never will I leave you; never will I forsake you."
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.relevance: True security comes from God's presence and promises, not from financial accumulation.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.application: Choose music that promotes trust in God's provision and contentment with His blessings.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_value: This passage helps understand why materialism_greed is concerning from a biblical perspective.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.concern_explanation: Excessive focus on material wealth can distract from spiritual priorities and contentment in God.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_context: Biblical foundation for understanding materialism_greed concerns

expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.text: Let everyone be subject to the governing authorities, for there is no authority except that which God has established.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.relevance: God establishes human authority structures and expects believers to respect them, even when we disagree.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.application: Choose music that promotes respect for legitimate authority while maintaining allegiance to God's ultimate authority.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_value: This passage helps understand why rebellion_authority is concerning from a biblical perspective.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.concern_explanation: Constant rebellion against legitimate authority contradicts biblical principles of submission and respect.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_context: Biblical foundation for understanding rebellion_authority concerns

expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.text: Have confidence in your leaders and submit to their authority, because they keep watch over you as those who must give an account.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.relevance: Submission to authority is not weakness but recognition of God's order and the accountability of leaders.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.application: Select music that encourages working within proper channels for change rather than promoting destructive rebellion.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_value: This passage helps understand why rebellion_authority is concerning from a biblical perspective.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.concern_explanation: Constant rebellion against legitimate authority contradicts biblical principles of submission and respect.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_context: Biblical foundation for understanding rebellion_authority concerns

expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.text: Submit yourselves for the Lord's sake to every human authority: whether to the emperor, as the supreme authority, or to governors, who are sent by him to punish the wrongdoer and to commend those who do right.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.relevance: Submission to authority is ultimately an act of obedience to God, not just compliance with human institutions.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.application: Choose music that demonstrates respect for authority as a way of honoring God, even while seeking justice.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_value: This passage helps understand why rebellion_authority is concerning from a biblical perspective.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.concern_explanation: Constant rebellion against legitimate authority contradicts biblical principles of submission and respect.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_context: Biblical foundation for understanding rebellion_authority concerns

expected_purity_flags_details.description: Excessive focus on material wealth can distract from spiritual priorities and contentment in God.
expected_purity_flags_details.biblical_perspective: 1 Timothy 6:10 warns that the love of money is the root of all kinds of evil.
expected_purity_flags_details.educational_value: This content shows materialism and greed concerns. Excessive focus on material wealth can distract from spiritual priorities and contentment in God. Biblical guidance: 1 Timothy 6:10 warns that the love of money is the root of all kinds of evil. Consider: Find satisfaction in God's provision and focus on eternal rather than temporary treasures.

expected_purity_flags_details.description: Constant rebellion against legitimate authority contradicts biblical principles of submission and respect.
expected_purity_flags_details.biblical_perspective: Romans 13:1 teaches that all authority is established by God.
expected_purity_flags_details.educational_value: This content shows rebellion against authority concerns. Constant rebellion against legitimate authority contradicts biblical principles of submission and respect. Biblical guidance: Romans 13:1 teaches that all authority is established by God. Consider: Address grievances respectfully while honoring God-given authority structures.

title: Sleep Apnea
lyrics:
There sat a new test
 Much harder that you bought in
 As for the unseen, just take care of what you will
 Light the silent alarm
 We never think that we're missing much 'til
 I gasp and hold my breath
 These needs had changed so deep
 To face you all and say
 I've been awake for
 I need a new test
 Then I set out to choose someone to
 Light the soul like a kiln
 Just imagine us chasing this with
 Eyes scorned from sleep apnea
 A slight of tongue as the seas are empty
 I gasp and hold my breath
 These needs have changed so deep
 To face you all and say
 I've been awake for
 Ever
 Ever
 Ever

 Ever
 Try to read off a letter, that's falling apart
 The sun and the moon, I count sheep
 Escape like an animal, I'm ready for my sleepless stroll

 I felt these shifting hours mistakenly used up
 So, I gasp and hold my breath
 These needs have changed, so deep
 To face you all, and say
 I've been awake for years
 I gasp and hold my breath
 These needs have changed so deep
 To face you all and say
 I've been awake for
 Ever!
 Ever!
 Ever!
 Ever!

expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.text: Do you not know that your bodies are temples of the Holy Spirit, who is in you, whom you have received from God? You are not your own; you were bought at a price. Therefore honor God with your bodies.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.relevance: Our bodies belong to God and should be treated with the respect due to His dwelling place. Substance abuse dishonors this sacred relationship.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.application: Choose music that promotes healthy living and respect for the body as God's temple, avoiding content that glorifies substance abuse.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_value: This passage helps understand why substance_abuse is concerning from a biblical perspective.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.concern_explanation: Substance use can impair judgment and become a substitute for finding peace in God.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_context: Biblical foundation for understanding substance_abuse concerns

expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.text: Wine is a mocker and beer a brawler; whoever is led astray by them is not wise.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.relevance: Scripture warns against being controlled by alcohol or substances that impair judgment and lead to unwise decisions.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.application: Select music that promotes wisdom and clear thinking rather than celebrating intoxication or substance use.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_value: This passage helps understand why substance_abuse is concerning from a biblical perspective.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.concern_explanation: Substance use can impair judgment and become a substitute for finding peace in God.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_context: Biblical foundation for understanding substance_abuse concerns

expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.text: So I say, walk by the Spirit, and you will not gratify the desires of the flesh. For the flesh desires what is contrary to the Spirit.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.relevance: Living by the Spirit means rejecting fleshly desires, including dependencies on substances for comfort or escape.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.application: Choose music that encourages spiritual dependence on God rather than physical dependence on substances.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_value: This passage helps understand why substance_abuse is concerning from a biblical perspective.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.concern_explanation: Substance use can impair judgment and become a substitute for finding peace in God.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_context: Biblical foundation for understanding substance_abuse concerns

expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.text: Pride goes before destruction, a haughty spirit before a fall.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.relevance: Pride is spiritually dangerous because it leads to poor decisions and separation from God who opposes the proud.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.application: Choose music that promotes humility and dependence on God rather than self-exaltation or arrogance.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_value: This passage helps understand why pride_arrogance is concerning from a biblical perspective.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.concern_explanation: Excessive self-focus can lead to pride and take glory away from God.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_context: Biblical foundation for understanding pride_arrogance concerns

expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.text: But he gives us more grace. That is why Scripture says: "God opposes the proud but shows favor to the humble."
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.relevance: God actively resists pride but blesses humility with His grace and favor.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.application: Select music that cultivates a humble heart and acknowledges our need for God's grace.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_value: This passage helps understand why pride_arrogance is concerning from a biblical perspective.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.concern_explanation: Excessive self-focus can lead to pride and take glory away from God.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_context: Biblical foundation for understanding pride_arrogance concerns

expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.text: Do nothing out of selfish ambition or vain conceit. Rather, in humility value others above yourselves, not looking to your own interests but each of you to the interests of the others.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.relevance: True Christian character involves putting others' needs before our own and avoiding self-centered motivations.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.application: Choose music that inspires service to others and selfless love rather than self-focused content.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_value: This passage helps understand why pride_arrogance is concerning from a biblical perspective.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.concern_explanation: Excessive self-focus can lead to pride and take glory away from God.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_context: Biblical foundation for understanding pride_arrogance concerns

expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.text: May the God of hope fill you with all joy and peace as you trust in him, so that you may overflow with hope by the power of the Holy Spirit.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.relevance: God is the ultimate source of hope, providing supernatural joy and peace even in difficult circumstances.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.application: While acknowledging struggles is healthy, balance music that expresses pain with content that points to God's hope and healing.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_value: This passage helps understand why despair_hopelessness is concerning from a biblical perspective.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.concern_explanation: While acknowledging struggles is healthy, constant focus on despair without hope can be spiritually harmful.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_context: Biblical foundation for understanding despair_hopelessness concerns

expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.text: Why, my soul, are you downcast? Why so disturbed within me? Put your hope in God, for I will yet praise him, my Savior and my God.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.relevance: Even in depression and despair, believers can redirect their thoughts toward God's faithfulness and future deliverance.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.application: Choose music that acknowledges emotional struggles but also encourages faith and hope in God's goodness.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_value: This passage helps understand why despair_hopelessness is concerning from a biblical perspective.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.concern_explanation: While acknowledging struggles is healthy, constant focus on despair without hope can be spiritually harmful.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_context: Biblical foundation for understanding despair_hopelessness concerns

expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.text: Therefore we do not lose heart. Though outwardly we are wasting away, yet inwardly we are being renewed day by day. For our light and momentary troubles are achieving for us an eternal glory.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.relevance: Present sufferings are temporary and serve a purpose in God's plan, leading to future glory and spiritual growth.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.application: Select music that maintains eternal perspective on current struggles and encourages perseverance through difficulty.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_value: This passage helps understand why despair_hopelessness is concerning from a biblical perspective.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.concern_explanation: While acknowledging struggles is healthy, constant focus on despair without hope can be spiritually harmful.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_context: Biblical foundation for understanding despair_hopelessness concerns

title: La Negra Tiene Tumbao
lyrics:
Esa negrita que va caminando
 Esa negrita tiene su tumba'o
 Y cuando la gente la va mirando ella baila de la'o
 Tambin apreta'o, apreta'o, apreta'o
 (La negra tiene tumba'o) azcar, azcar
 (Y no camina de la'o)
 Si quieres llegar derecho
 Mejor camina de frente
 Para que no hayan tropiezos
 Y vengas, y te lamentes
 Si quieres llegar primero
 Mejor se corre despacio
 Disfruta bien de la vida (cario)
 Aunque tomando medidas (azcar)
 (La negra tiene tumba'o) tiene tumba'o, tiene tumba'o
 (Y no camina de la'o) y no camina de la'o, y no camina de la'o
 (La negra tiene tumba'o) ay, tumba'o
 (Nunca camina de la'o) nunca camina de la'o, de la'o
 (Tiene tumba'o, tiene tumba'o)
 (Anda derechito, no camina de la'o)
 (Tiene tumba'o, tiene tumba'o)
 Cuando la gente se muere (ay, Dios mo)
 Se dice que era tan buena (tan buena)
 Tan buena cuando viva
 Como la noche y el da (t crees?)
 Que a mi me vengan a decir la verdad
 No aguanto ya ms mentiras (siempre lo mismo)
 Disfruto bien de la vida
 Aunque tomando medidas (azcar)
 (La negra tiene tumba'o) tiene tumba'o, tiene tumba'o
 (Y no camina de la'o) Y no camina de la'o, y no camina de la'o
 (La negra tiene tumba'o) ay, tumba'o
 (Nunca camina de la'o) nunca camina de la'o, de la'o
 (Anda derechito, anda derechito, no camina de la'o)
 (La negra tiene tumba'o)
 Tiene tumba'o, anda derechito, no camina de la'o
 Diosa de la noche, dulce como el mela'o
 Otra como ella yo nunca he encontra'o
 Ven aqu para poder compartir
 Porque eres t la negra linda que me hace feliz (otra no quiero)
 Eres t la que me da inspiracin (sin ti me muero)
 Me hace falta amarte, mi corazn (otra no quiero)
 Si no ests siento desesperacin (sin ti me muero)
 Siempre amarte sera mi vocacin
 Tiene tumbao, anda derechito no camina de la'o
 Diosa de la noche, dulce como el mela'o
 Otra como ella yo nunca he encontra'o
 Esta negrita tiene tumba'o
 Todos la siguen por su camina'o
 Esta negrita tiene tumba'o
 Todos la siguen por su camina'o
 (La negra tiene tumba'o)
 (Y no camina de la'o)
 Esa negrita que va caminando
 Esa negrita tiene su tumba'o
 Y cuando la gente la va mirando ella baila de la'o
 Tambin apreta'o, apreta'o, apreta'o (azcar)
 (La negra tiene tumba'o) tiene tumba'o, tiene tumba'o
 (Y no camina de la'o) tiene tumba'o, tiene tumba'o
 Ay, tumba'o (ay, tumba'o)
 Nunca camina de la'o, de la'o
 (La negra tiene tumba'o) tiene tumba'o, tiene tumba'o
 (Y no camina de la'o) nunca camina de la'o, de la'o
 (La negra tiene tumba'o) tiene tumba'o, tiene tumba'o
 (Nunca camina de la'o)

title: 2's My Favorite 1
lyrics:
Two hearts beat as one
 Disguise your mind and feel the hum
 This drone, the buzz of our love
 In time, we move
 This churning factor, feel the groove
 Release the touch that moves you

 Oh, this is her
 No regrets
 I embrace your defects to confess you were my every wish
 I admit that I will never feel alone
 Once I call you home

 Push towards the dance floor
 And together we'll show them who's boss
 We'll set a fire once more
 Oh, this is her
 No regrets
 I embrace your defects to confess you were my every wish
 I admit that I will never feel alone
 Once I call you home

 Maybe it's not now or later
 'Til you save the best for last
 I want to be everything you need
 Woah

 Oh, this is her
 No regrets
 I embrace your defects to confess you were my every wish
 I admit that I will never feel
 No, I will never feel alone
 Our sum in monotone
 While the record spins around
 Please turn me over, slide me into sleeve
 Oh girl, please bring me, me home

expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.text: Flee from sexual immorality. All other sins a person commits are outside the body, but whoever sins sexually, sins against their own body. Do you not know that your bodies are temples of the Holy Spirit?
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.relevance: Sexual purity is not just a moral guideline but a recognition that our bodies are sacred dwelling places of God's Spirit.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.application: Choose music that honors the sacredness of sexuality within God's design and avoid content that promotes casual or immoral sexual behavior.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_value: This passage helps understand why sexual_content is concerning from a biblical perspective.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.concern_explanation: Sexual content outside biblical marriage context can promote impure thoughts and desires.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_context: Biblical foundation for understanding sexual_content concerns

expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.text: It is God's will that you should be sanctified: that you should avoid sexual immorality; that each of you should learn to control your own body in a way that is holy and honorable.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.relevance: God's will for believers includes sexual purity as part of our overall sanctification and spiritual growth.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.application: Select music that supports your commitment to sexual purity and helps you maintain holy thoughts and desires.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_value: This passage helps understand why sexual_content is concerning from a biblical perspective.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.concern_explanation: Sexual content outside biblical marriage context can promote impure thoughts and desires.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_context: Biblical foundation for understanding sexual_content concerns

expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.text: But I tell you that anyone who looks at a woman lustfully has already committed adultery with her in his heart.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.relevance: Jesus teaches that sexual purity begins in the heart and mind, not just in physical actions.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.application: Be mindful that music can influence your thought life; choose content that helps maintain pure thoughts.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_value: This passage helps understand why sexual_content is concerning from a biblical perspective.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.concern_explanation: Sexual content outside biblical marriage context can promote impure thoughts and desires.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_context: Biblical foundation for understanding sexual_content concerns

expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.text: Pride goes before destruction, a haughty spirit before a fall.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.relevance: Pride is spiritually dangerous because it leads to poor decisions and separation from God who opposes the proud.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.application: Choose music that promotes humility and dependence on God rather than self-exaltation or arrogance.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_value: This passage helps understand why pride_arrogance is concerning from a biblical perspective.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.concern_explanation: Excessive self-focus can lead to pride and take glory away from God.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_context: Biblical foundation for understanding pride_arrogance concerns

expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.text: But he gives us more grace. That is why Scripture says: "God opposes the proud but shows favor to the humble."
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.relevance: God actively resists pride but blesses humility with His grace and favor.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.application: Select music that cultivates a humble heart and acknowledges our need for God's grace.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_value: This passage helps understand why pride_arrogance is concerning from a biblical perspective.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.concern_explanation: Excessive self-focus can lead to pride and take glory away from God.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_context: Biblical foundation for understanding pride_arrogance concerns

expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.text: Do nothing out of selfish ambition or vain conceit. Rather, in humility value others above yourselves, not looking to your own interests but each of you to the interests of the others.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.relevance: True Christian character involves putting others' needs before our own and avoiding self-centered motivations.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.application: Choose music that inspires service to others and selfless love rather than self-focused content.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_value: This passage helps understand why pride_arrogance is concerning from a biblical perspective.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.concern_explanation: Excessive self-focus can lead to pride and take glory away from God.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_context: Biblical foundation for understanding pride_arrogance concerns

expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.text: May the God of hope fill you with all joy and peace as you trust in him, so that you may overflow with hope by the power of the Holy Spirit.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.relevance: God is the ultimate source of hope, providing supernatural joy and peace even in difficult circumstances.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.application: While acknowledging struggles is healthy, balance music that expresses pain with content that points to God's hope and healing.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_value: This passage helps understand why despair_hopelessness is concerning from a biblical perspective.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.concern_explanation: While acknowledging struggles is healthy, constant focus on despair without hope can be spiritually harmful.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_context: Biblical foundation for understanding despair_hopelessness concerns

expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.text: Why, my soul, are you downcast? Why so disturbed within me? Put your hope in God, for I will yet praise him, my Savior and my God.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.relevance: Even in depression and despair, believers can redirect their thoughts toward God's faithfulness and future deliverance.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.application: Choose music that acknowledges emotional struggles but also encourages faith and hope in God's goodness.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_value: This passage helps understand why despair_hopelessness is concerning from a biblical perspective.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.concern_explanation: While acknowledging struggles is healthy, constant focus on despair without hope can be spiritually harmful.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_context: Biblical foundation for understanding despair_hopelessness concerns

expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.text: Therefore we do not lose heart. Though outwardly we are wasting away, yet inwardly we are being renewed day by day. For our light and momentary troubles are achieving for us an eternal glory.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.relevance: Present sufferings are temporary and serve a purpose in God's plan, leading to future glory and spiritual growth.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.application: Select music that maintains eternal perspective on current struggles and encourages perseverance through difficulty.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_value: This passage helps understand why despair_hopelessness is concerning from a biblical perspective.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.concern_explanation: While acknowledging struggles is healthy, constant focus on despair without hope can be spiritually harmful.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_context: Biblical foundation for understanding despair_hopelessness concerns

expected_purity_flags_details.description: Sexual content outside biblical marriage context can promote impure thoughts and desires.
expected_purity_flags_details.biblical_perspective: 1 Corinthians 6:18-20 calls us to honor God with our bodies and flee sexual immorality.
expected_purity_flags_details.educational_value: This content shows sexual purity concerns. Sexual content outside biblical marriage context can promote impure thoughts and desires. Biblical guidance: 1 Corinthians 6:18-20 calls us to honor God with our bodies and flee sexual immorality. Consider: Focus on pure love, commitment, and God-honoring relationships.

expected_purity_flags_details.description: Excessive self-focus can lead to pride and take glory away from God.
expected_purity_flags_details.biblical_perspective: Proverbs 16:18 warns that pride goes before destruction and a haughty spirit before a fall.
expected_purity_flags_details.educational_value: This content shows pride and self-focus concerns. Excessive self-focus can lead to pride and take glory away from God. Biblical guidance: Proverbs 16:18 warns that pride goes before destruction and a haughty spirit before a fall. Consider: Practice humility, recognizing that all good things come from God.

expected_purity_flags_details.description: While acknowledging struggles is healthy, constant focus on despair without hope can be spiritually harmful.
expected_purity_flags_details.biblical_perspective: Romans 15:13 declares God as the source of hope who fills us with joy and peace.
expected_purity_flags_details.educational_value: This content shows despair and mental health concerns. While acknowledging struggles is healthy, constant focus on despair without hope can be spiritually harmful. Biblical guidance: Romans 15:13 declares God as the source of hope who fills us with joy and peace. Consider: Balance honest expression of difficulties with reminders of God's love, hope, and healing.

title: Committed to the Con
lyrics:
Hey you get the fuck off my lawn
 You're so damn committed to the con'
 All standards set and all lines drawn
 And there's no question which side I'm on
 Which side are you on?
 Which side are you on?
 Which side are you on?
 Which side are you on?

 Rich boy on his hoard of milk and honey
 Kneeling at the alter of inherited money
 And all the marks are in it to win it
 But he's selling yesterday's lottery tickets
 Which side are you on?
 Which side are you on?
 Which side are you on?
 Which side are you on?
 Which side are you on?
 Which side are you on? (Which side are you on?)
 Which side are you on?
 Which side are you on?

 Which side are you on? (Which side are you on?)
 Which side are you on?
 Which side are you on?
 Which side are you on?
 Which side are you on?
 Which side are you on?
 Which side are you on?
 Which side are you on?

expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.text: Do not let any unwholesome talk come out of your mouths, but only what is helpful for building others up according to their needs.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.relevance: God calls us to use words that build up rather than tear down. Our speech should reflect His character and promote the wellbeing of others.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.application: Choose music with lyrics that encourage, inspire, and reflect the purity of heart that God desires for His children.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_value: This passage helps understand why explicit_language is concerning from a biblical perspective.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.concern_explanation: Inappropriate language can harm our witness and fail to reflect Christ's love.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_context: Biblical foundation for understanding explicit_language concerns

expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.text: With the tongue we praise our Lord and Father, and with it we curse human beings, who have been made in God's likeness. Out of the same mouth come praise and cursing. My brothers and sisters, this should not be.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.relevance: Our words reveal the condition of our hearts. The same voice that praises God should not be used to degrade what He has created.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.application: Select music that honors both God and fellow human beings, avoiding content that demeans or degrades others.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_value: This passage helps understand why explicit_language is concerning from a biblical perspective.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.concern_explanation: Inappropriate language can harm our witness and fail to reflect Christ's love.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_context: Biblical foundation for understanding explicit_language concerns

expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.text: Let your conversation be always full of grace, seasoned with salt, so that you may know how to answer everyone.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.relevance: Christian speech should be gracious and purposeful, adding value to conversations and relationships.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.application: Seek music that models gracious communication and positive interaction with others.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_value: This passage helps understand why explicit_language is concerning from a biblical perspective.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.concern_explanation: Inappropriate language can harm our witness and fail to reflect Christ's love.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_context: Biblical foundation for understanding explicit_language concerns

expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.text: For the love of money is a root of all kinds of evil. Some people, eager for money, have wandered from the faith and pierced themselves with many griefs.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.relevance: The pursuit of wealth can become an idol that leads us away from God and causes spiritual harm.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.application: Choose music that promotes contentment and gratitude rather than materialism and the pursuit of wealth.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_value: This passage helps understand why materialism_greed is concerning from a biblical perspective.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.concern_explanation: Excessive focus on material wealth can distract from spiritual priorities and contentment in God.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_context: Biblical foundation for understanding materialism_greed concerns

expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.text: Do not store up for yourselves treasures on earth, where moths and vermin destroy, and where thieves break in and steal. But store up for yourselves treasures in heaven.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.relevance: Jesus teaches that earthly possessions are temporary and unreliable, while spiritual investments have eternal value.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.application: Select music that focuses on eternal values and spiritual growth rather than temporary material pursuits.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_value: This passage helps understand why materialism_greed is concerning from a biblical perspective.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.concern_explanation: Excessive focus on material wealth can distract from spiritual priorities and contentment in God.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_context: Biblical foundation for understanding materialism_greed concerns

expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.text: Keep your lives free from the love of money and be content with what you have, because God has said, "Never will I leave you; never will I forsake you."
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.relevance: True security comes from God's presence and promises, not from financial accumulation.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.application: Choose music that promotes trust in God's provision and contentment with His blessings.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_value: This passage helps understand why materialism_greed is concerning from a biblical perspective.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.concern_explanation: Excessive focus on material wealth can distract from spiritual priorities and contentment in God.
expected_supporting_scripture_detailed.educational_context: Biblical foundation for understanding materialism_greed concerns

expected_purity_flags_details.description: Inappropriate language can harm our witness and fail to reflect Christ's love.
expected_purity_flags_details.biblical_perspective: Ephesians 4:29 teaches us to use words that build up rather than tear down.
expected_purity_flags_details.educational_value: This content shows language and expression concerns. Inappropriate language can harm our witness and fail to reflect Christ's love. Biblical guidance: Ephesians 4:29 teaches us to use words that build up rather than tear down. Consider: Choose words that encourage and edify others, reflecting God's character.

expected_purity_flags_details.description: Excessive focus on material wealth can distract from spiritual priorities and contentment in God.
expected_purity_flags_details.biblical_perspective: 1 Timothy 6:10 warns that the love of money is the root of all kinds of evil.
expected_purity_flags_details.educational_value: This content shows materialism and greed concerns. Excessive focus on material wealth can distract from spiritual priorities and contentment in God. Biblical guidance: 1 Timothy 6:10 warns that the love of money is the root of all kinds of evil. Consider: Find satisfaction in God's provision and focus on eternal rather than temporary treasures.
